words.def: so thin as to transmit light
a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
the members of a business organization that owns or operates one or more establishments
two-winged insects characterized by active flight
nonresinous wood of a fir tree
A Nordic dairy product, similar to yoghurt, but using different bacteria which give a different taste and texture.
the shape of a raised edge of a more or less circular object
a Cypriot monetary unit equal to one thousandth of a pound
An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.
destruction of heart tissue resulting from obstruction of the blood supply to the heart muscle
a soft silver-white univalent element of the alkali metal group
